title: 1989 24 Hours of Daytona
text:
The 27th Annual SunBank 24 at Daytona was a 24-hour <a href="Endurance%20racing%20%28motorsport%29">endurance</a> <a href="Sports%20car%20racing">sports car race</a> held on February 4–5, 1989 at the <a href="Daytona%20International%20Speedway">Daytona International Speedway</a> road course. The race served as the opening round of the <a href="1989%20IMSA%20GT%20Championship">1989 IMSA GT Championship</a>.
Victory overall and in the GTP class went to the No. 67 Miller High Life/BF Goodrich 962 <a href="Porsche%20962">Porsche 962</a> driven by <a href="Bob%20Wollek">Bob Wollek</a>, <a href="Derek%20Bell%20%28racing%20driver%29">Derek Bell</a>, and <a href="John%20Andretti">John Andretti</a>. Victory in the Lights class went to the No. 9 Essex Racing Tiga GT288 driven by Charles Morgan, John Morrison, and Tom Hessert Jr. The GTO class was won by the No. 16 Stroh's Light Cougar <a href="Mercury%20Cougar">Mercury Cougar</a> XR-7 driven by <a href="Pete%20Halsmer">Pete Halsmer</a>, <a href="Bob%20Earl">Bob Earl</a>, <a href="Mark%20Martin">Mark Martin</a>, and <a href="Paul%20Stewart%20%28racing%20driver%29">Paul Stewart</a>. Finally, the GTU class was won by the No. 17 Al Bacon Performance <a href="Mazda%20RX-7">Mazda RX-7</a> driven by Al Bacon, Bob Reed, and <a href="Rod%20Millen">Rod Millen</a>.
Race results.
Class winners in bold.
